page.title: 18A Walk In the Chilterns.
page.content: We set off from the school on Friday July 5th 1985 and walked along the A4010 towards Great Kimble. We passed fields of barley,hay and grass. In Great Kimble we turned South East along the North Bucks Way. On the northen side the land is a nature reserve belonging to Bucks, Berks Oxford Naturalist Trust and there was an abundace of the spotted orchid. We crossed a grass field which was ready for cutting and then joined the Ridgeway Path with woods on the West side and fields of spring barley and winter wheat on the East side. We retraced our steps to the Old Rifle Butts on the slopes of the chilterns facing west and below was a field of oil seed rape.The woods slopes form a National Trust Nature Reserve.We crossed the road and followed a foot-path to the golf course.
